25.heading: Kr√§germann, Andreas, 1963-
25.title: "Superman aus der Gartenlaube"
25.author: von Andreas Kr√§germann und Eckart Sackmann
notes: Begins: "Ausgerechnet in der Gartenlaube erschien Ende der 1930er Jahre ein Comic, der auf amerikanische Vorbilder verweist und in der Comicliterature der Zeit die grosse Ausname ist. 'Famany', der 'erste Deutsche Bildroman', wendet sich offenbar an den erwachsenen Leser."
Article about a superhero comic feature titled Famanay, der fliegende Mensch (Famanay, the Flying Man) which appeared in the magazine Die Gartenlaube in 1937. The story takes place in New York City.

37.heading: Kraemer, Joseph.
37.title: A Gallery of Pen Sketches in Black and White of our Michigan Friends "as we see 'em"
37.author: by Newspaper Cartoonists' Association of Michigan.
notes: Cover title: Our Michigan friends "as we see 'em."

Most of the caricatures are signed, and in the front of the book are photographic portraits of cartoonists A.G. Allan (Free Press), Fred C. Nash (Free Press), Fred I. Leipziger (Detroit News), Joseph Kraemer (Detroit News), W.W. Clarke (Detroit News), W.J. Baker (Detroit News), W.T. Bailes (Detroit News), B.R. Thomas (Detroit News), John J. Walsh (Free Press), Vera Casseau (Free Press), Burton R. Law, H.G. Berkey, Louis W. Tower, John F. Gilbert, Fred C. Hunt, Drury V. Haight, and C.O. Youngstrand.

99.title: The Variable Syndrome
99.author: Don McGregor ; cover art by Walt Simonson ; edited by David Anthony Kraft.
notes: On cover: "A major new science fiction novel!"

The final section of the book is introduced in this way: "A chronology, from conception to publication, of the comics novel by Don McGregor and Marshall Rogers (with a few digressions, side stories, and observations about the commercial comics scene, birth, 'The Variable Syndrome,' 'An Erotic Priority,' a comics contest of will, and various other matters, along the way)."

208.heading: Kramsky, Jerry--Miscellanea.
208.title: "Conversation avec Lorenzo Mattotti"
208.author: Gilles Ciment & Jean-Pierre Mercier
208.appears_in: p. 46-56 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Mus√©e de la Bande Dessin√©e, no. 9 (Oct. 2003). Begins: "Illustrateur et affichiste parmi les plus demand√©s, Mattotti a su imposer un style imm√©diatement reconnaissable. Il poursuit parall√®lement son travail d'auteur de bandes dessin√©es, sans suivre d'autre r√®gle que celle de son d√©sir et de sa curiosit√©. Deux albums r√©cents (Dr Jeckyll et Mr Hyde, Le Bruit du Givre) et plusieurs r√©√©ditions lui ont assur√© une fort pr√©sence dans les librairies depuis quelques mois. 9e Art ne pouvait laisser passer l'occasion de saluer un ma√Ætre qui a tenu toutes les promesses de Feux, l'album programmatique paru en 1986."
notes: English summary (from p. 126): "A Conversation with Lorenzo Mattotti. Interviewed by Gilles Ciment and Jean-Pierre Mercier, the great Italian artist evokes his comics debut in depth, his acquaintance with Jerry Kramsky and the Valvoline group, but also his approach to painting, posters and comics. He pays particular attention to the genesis of his two last albums: Doctor Jeckyll and Mister Hyde after Stevenson (Casterman) and Le Bruit du Givre (√©d. du Seuil)."
